trans-unit.source: A flow content element that represents a particular content item in an ordered or unordered <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.List"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.ListItem> enforces a strong content model for child content.
See [TextElement Content Model Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/textelement-content-model-overview.md) for more information about the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.ListItem> content model.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.ListItem> elements must be contained by a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.List> element.
Initializes a new, empty instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref> class.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref> class, taking a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph"></xref> object as the initial contents of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph"></xref> object specifying the initial contents of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref>.
Gets a block collection that contains the top-level <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Block"></xref> elements of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref>.
Use the block collection returned by this property to enumerate or manipulate the contents of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Section> element.
A block collection that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Block"></xref> elements of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref>
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Brush"></xref> to use when painting the element's border.
For a table of swatches that show the available predefined brush colors, see <xref:System.Windows.Media.Brushes>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
The brush used to apply to the element's border.
The default is `null`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem.BorderBrush"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the border thickness for the element.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*uniformThickness*
String representation of a single <xref:System.Double> value to apply uniformly to all four thickness dimensions.
For example, a value of `"10"` is equivalent to a value of `"10,10,10,10"`.
An unqualified value is measured in device independent pixels.
Strings need not explicitly include decimal points.
*independentThickness*
String representation of four ordered <xref:System.Double> values corresponding to independent thickness dimensions for left, top, right, and bottom, in this order.
The four values must be separated with commas; spaces are not allowed.

For example, "5,10,15,20" results in 5 pixels of border to the left of content, 10 pixels of border above content, 15 pixels of border to the right of content, and 20 pixels of border below the content.
*qualifiedUniformThickness*
A value described by *uniformThickness* followed by one of the following unit specifiers: `px`, `in`.
`px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-dipixelsharpplural-md.md)]
`in` is inches; 1in==96px
For example, `"1in"` provides uniform border of 1 inch in all directions.
*qualifiedIndependentThickness*
A value described by *independentThickness*, with each independent value followed by one of the following unit specifiers: `px`, `in`.
`px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-dipixelsharpplural-md.md)]
`in` is inches; 1in==96px
For example, `"1.5in,0.8in,1.5in,0.8in"`.
Unit specifiers may be mixed or omitted from one or more values.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
A <xref href="System.Windows.Thickness"></xref> structure that specifies the amount of border to apply, in device independent pixels.
The default is a uniform thickness of zero (0.0).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem.BorderThickness"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the relative direction for flow of content within a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref> element.
Getting this property returns the currently effective flow direction.
Setting this property causes the contents of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.ListItem> element to re-flow in the indicated direction.
The flow direction of content typically corresponds to the innate flow direction of the language being represented.
Hebrew and Arabic are examples of languages that naturally flow from right to left.
English, German, and Russian are examples of languages that naturally flow from left to right.
The value of this property is not automatically changed to match the language used by the operating system.
If you need to use a different value than the default of <xref:System.Windows.FlowDirection.LeftToRight>, you must specify it yourself.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Inherits%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsParentArrange%2A>
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.FlowDirection"></xref> values that specifies the relative flow direction.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.FlowDirection.LeftToRight"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem.FlowDirection"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the height of each line of content.
Changing the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.ListItem.LineHeight%2A> value does not change the height of the associated text; rather, it changes the height of the line that contains the text.
In addition to this property, the layout of lines in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.ListItem> is affected by its <xref:System.Windows.Documents.ListItem.LineStackingStrategy%2A> property.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*double*
String representation of a <xref:System.Double> value in the range `0.0034` to `160000`.
An unqualified value is measured in device independent pixels.
Strings need not explicitly include decimal points.
*qualifiedDouble*
A *double* value as described above, (excepting `Auto`) followed by one of the following unit specifiers: `px`, `in`, `cm`, `pt`.
`px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-dipixelsharpplural-md.md)]
`in` is inches; 1in==96px
`cm` is centimeters; 1cm==(96/2.54) px
`pt` is points; 1pt==(96/72) px
Auto
Causes the line height to be determined automatically from the current font characteristics.
Equivalent to a property value of <xref:System.Double.NaN?displayProperty=fullName>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsMeasure%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Inherits%2A>
The height of each line in device independent pixels with a value range of 0.0034 to 160000.
A value of (equivalent to an attribute value of "Auto") causes the line height to be determined automatically from the current font characteristics.
The default is <xref href="System.Double.NaN"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem.LineHeight"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the mechanism by which a line box is determined for each line of text within the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsMeasure%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Inherits%2A>

One of the <xref href="System.Windows.LineStackingStrategy"></xref> values that specifies the mechanism by which a line box is determined for each line of text within the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref>.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.LineStackingStrategy.MaxHeight"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem.LineStackingStrategy"></xref> dependency property.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.List"></xref> that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref>.
The list that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref>.
Gets or sets the margin thickness for the element.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.ListItem.Margin%2A> is buffer space that falls outside an element's content area, between the edges of the element's content area and the edges of the parent element.
Contrast with <xref:System.Windows.Documents.ListItem.Padding%2A>, which is buffer space that falls inside an element's content area, between the element's content and the inner edge of the element.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*uniformThickness*
String representation of a single <xref:System.Double> value to apply uniformly to all four thickness dimensions.
For example, a value of `"10"` is equivalent to a value of `"10,10,10,10"`.
An unqualified value is measured in device independent pixels.
Strings need not explicitly include decimal points.
*independentThickness*
String representation of four ordered <xref:System.Double> values corresponding to independent thickness dimensions for left, top, right, and bottom, in this order.
The four values must be separated with commas; spaces are not allowed.

For example, "5,10,15,20" results in 5 pixels of margin to the left of content, 10 pixels of margin above content, 15 pixels of margin to the right of content, and 20 pixels of margin below the content.
*qualifiedUniformThickness*
A value described by *uniformThickness* followed by one of the following unit specifiers: `px`, `in`.
`px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-dipixelsharpplural-md.md)]
`in` is inches; 1in==96px
For example, `"1in"` provides uniform margin of 1 inch in all directions.
*qualifiedIndependentThickness*
A value described by *independentThickness*, with each independent value followed by one of the following unit specifiers: `px`, `in`.
`px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-dipixelsharpplural-md.md)]
`in` is inches; 1in==96px
For example, `"1.5in,0.8in,1.5in,0.8in"`.
Unit specifiers may be mixed or omitted from one or more values.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
A <xref href="System.Windows.Thickness"></xref> structure that specifies the amount of margin to apply, in device independent pixels.
The default is a uniform thickness of zero (0.0).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem.Margin"></xref> dependency property.
Gets the next <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref> in the containing <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.List"></xref>.

The next <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref> in the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.List"></xref>, or `null` if there is no next <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref>.
Gets or sets the padding thickness for the element.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.ListItem.Padding%2A> is buffer space that falls inside an element's content area, between the element's content and the inner edge of the element.

Contrast with <xref:System.Windows.Documents.ListItem.Margin%2A>, which is buffer space that falls outside an element's content area, between the edges of the element's content area and the edges of the parent element.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*uniformThickness*
String representation of a single <xref:System.Double> value to apply uniformly to all four thickness dimensions.
For example, a value of `"10"` is equivalent to a value of `"10,10,10,10"`.
An unqualified value is measured in device independent pixels.
Strings need not explicitly include decimal points.
*independentThickness*
String representation of four ordered <xref:System.Double> values corresponding to independent thickness dimensions for left, top, right, and bottom, in this order.
The four values must be separated with commas; spaces are not allowed.

For example, "5,10,15,20" results in 5 pixels of padding to the left of content, 10 pixels of padding above content, 15 pixels of padding to the right of content, and 20 pixels of padding below the content.
*qualifiedUniformThickness*
A value described by *uniformThickness* followed by one of the following unit specifiers: `px`, `in`.
`px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-dipixelsharpplural-md.md)]
`in` is inches; 1in==96px
For example, `"1in"` provides uniform padding of 1 inch in all directions.
*qualifiedIndependentThickness*
A value described by *independentThickness*, with each independent value followed by one of the following unit specifiers: `px`, `in`.
`px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-dipixelsharpplural-md.md)]
`in` is inches; 1in==96px
For example, `"1.5in,0.8in,1.5in,0.8in"`.
Unit specifiers may be mixed or omitted from one or more values.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
A <xref href="System.Windows.Thickness"></xref> structure that specifies the amount of padding to apply, in device independent pixels.
The default is a uniform thickness of zero (0.0).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem.Padding"></xref> dependency property.
Gets the previous <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref> in the containing <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.List"></xref>.

The previous <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref> in the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.List"></xref>, or `null` if there is no previous <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref>.

Returns a value that indicates whether the effective value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem.Blocks"></xref> property should be serialized during serialization of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref> object.
A serialization service manager object for the object.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem.Blocks"></xref> property should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
manager is `null`.

Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItemCollection"></xref> that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref> elements that are siblings of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref> element.

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.ListItemCollection> returned by this property includes the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.ListItem> element through which the collection is accessed; that is, the element that owns this property is considered to be its own sibling for the purposes of generating the collection of siblings.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItemCollection"></xref> that contains the child <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref> elements that are directly hosted by the parent of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref> element, or `null` if the current <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem"></xref> element has no parent.
Gets or sets a value that indicates the horizontal alignment of text content.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsMeasure%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Inherits%2A>
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.TextAlignment"></xref> values that specifies the desired alignment.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.TextAlignment.Left"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ListItem.TextAlignment"></xref> dependency property.
